Subjective: Fatigue x2 months; sleeping a lot, waking up tired; able to work and exercise; increased muscle/back pain; morning stiffness; no joint pain; no weight loss; no night sweats; no fever; no respiratory issues; no chest pain; no palpitations; no abdominal pain; no change in bowel habits; no allergies. Social: No smoking; no alcohol. Request: Blood tests for anemia, thyroid, inflammation.
Objective: BP 110/60; HR 40-60; lungs clear; back exam normal; abdomen soft, no tenderness.
Assessment: Fatigue of unknown origin; possible anemia; possible thyroid dysfunction; possible inflammation; no evidence of rheumatoid arthritis or chronic conditions.
Plan: Blood tests: CBC, TSH, CRP, ESR; follow-up in 1 week to discuss results; continue monitoring symptoms; contact if symptoms worsen.
